intro: Cratystylis subspinescens, commonly known as the spiny cratystylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers. The plant has woody stems and produces small, oval-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It is often found in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
